comment.author: 41894168711@N01
comment._content: This is a wonderful collection of photos... Thank you for taking the time to compile it!

comment.author: 59164834@N06
comment._content:
We just may have found our grandfather here in this picture.
I would like to know who the soldier's name is who is in the bottom row and the 5th soldier from the left. 
My mother's father William Howard aka William Ernest Smith applied in 1946 to serve in Japan as a volunteer, his application form is in his WWII (417242) war record.
So far we have no photo whatever of our grandfather.
My mother was given up for adoption but we now know who her father was. He was a cook in WWII and was last living in Healesville Vic from 1963-1975 and worked as a cook from 1963-1972 at the Alpine Retreat Hotel in Warburton Vic.
If anyone can confirm the soldier's name or all of these soldiers it would be much appreciated. William also served in WWI in France 1917. William's brother Albert Horace Smith died at Fromelles June 1916.
William was born in Bega under the true name of William Ernest Smith 1891.

comment.author: 38958089@N03
comment._content:
My dad was in 3 Batallion RAR - but was enlisted as Leonard (Len) Morris because he was 15 years old and ended up in Korea for 4-6 weeks)  His real name is Len Berry - does anyone have any info.  Army does not have records that are relevant to him under the alias.  Dad is still alive at 77 and would love some proof he was there.  Please help us.  Thank you.
email address is wocket1502@yahoo.com.au - he would have been there 1951 at a guess.
